25class CodeAddressMap : public CodeEventLogger {
26 public:
27 explicit CodeAddressMap(Isolate* isolate) : CodeEventLogger(isolate) {
28 CHECK(isolate->logger()->AddListener(this));
29 }
30
31 ~CodeAddressMap() override {
32 CHECK(isolate_->logger()->RemoveListener(this));
33 }
34
35 void CodeMoveEvent(Tagged<InstructionStream> from,
36 Tagged<InstructionStream> to) override {
37 address_to_name_map_.Move(from.address(), to.address());
38 }
39 void BytecodeMoveEvent(Tagged<BytecodeArray> from,
40 Tagged<BytecodeArray> to) override {
41 address_to_name_map_.Move(from.address(), to.address());
42 }
43
44 void CodeDisableOptEvent(Handle<AbstractCode> code,
45 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared) override {}
46
47 const char* Lookup(Address address) {
48 return address_to_name_map_.Lookup(address);
49 }
50
51 private:
52 class NameMap {
53 public:
54 NameMap() : impl_() {}
55 NameMap(const NameMap&) = delete;
56 NameMap& operator=(const NameMap&) = delete;
57
58 ~NameMap() {
59 for (base::HashMap::Entry* p = impl_.Start(); p != nullptr;
60 p = impl_.Next(p)) {
61 DeleteArray(static_cast<const char*>(p->value));
62 }
63 }
64
65 void Insert(Address code_address, const char* name, int name_size) {
66 base::HashMap::Entry* entry = FindOrCreateEntry(code_address);
67 if (entry->value == nullptr) {
68 entry->value = CopyName(name, name_size);
69 }
70 }
71
72 const char* Lookup(Address code_address) {
73 base::HashMap::Entry* entry = FindEntry(code_address);
74 return (entry != nullptr) ? static_cast<const char*>(entry->value)
75 : nullptr;
76 }
77
78 void Remove(Address code_address) {
79 base::HashMap::Entry* entry = FindEntry(code_address);
80 if (entry != nullptr) {
81 DeleteArray(static_cast<char*>(entry->value));
82 RemoveEntry(entry);
83 }
84 }
85
86 void Move(Address from, Address to) {
87 if (from == to) return;
88 base::HashMap::Entry* from_entry = FindEntry(from);
89 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(from_entry);
90 void* value = from_entry->value;
91 RemoveEntry(from_entry);
92 base::HashMap::Entry* to_entry = FindOrCreateEntry(to);
93 DCHECK_NULL(to_entry->value);
94 to_entry->value = value;
95 }
96
97 private:
98 static char* CopyName(const char* name, int name_size) {
99 char* result = NewArray<char>(name_size + 1);
100 for (int i = 0; i < name_size; ++i) {
101 char c = name[i];
102 if (c == '\0') c = ' ';
103 result[i] = c;
104 }
105 result[name_size] = '\0';
106 return result;
107 }
108
109 base::HashMap::Entry* FindOrCreateEntry(Address code_address) {
110 return impl_.LookupOrInsert(reinterpret_cast<void*>(code_address),
111 ComputeAddressHash(code_address));
112 }
113
114 base::HashMap::Entry* FindEntry(Address code_address) {
115 return impl_.Lookup(reinterpret_cast<void*>(code_address),
116 ComputeAddressHash(code_address));
117 }
118
119 void RemoveEntry(base::HashMap::Entry* entry) {
120 impl_.Remove(entry->key, entry->hash);
121 }
122
123 base::HashMap impl_;
124 };
125
126 void LogRecordedBuffer(Tagged<AbstractCode> code,
127 MaybeHandle<SharedFunctionInfo>, const char* name,
128 int length) override {
129 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
130 address_to_name_map_.Insert(code.address(), name, length);
131 }
132
133#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
134 void LogRecordedBuffer(const wasm::WasmCode* code, const char* name,
135 int length) override {
136 UNREACHABLE();
137 }
138#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
139
140 NameMap address_to_name_map_;
141};
142
143class ObjectCacheIndexMap {
144 public:
145 explicit ObjectCacheIndexMap(Heap* heap) : map_(heap), next_index_(0) {}
146 ObjectCacheIndexMap(const ObjectCacheIndexMap&) = delete;
147 ObjectCacheIndexMap& operator=(const ObjectCacheIndexMap&) = delete;
148
149 // If |obj| is in the map, immediately return true. Otherwise add it to the
150 // map and return false. In either case set |*index_out| to the index
151 // associated with the map.
152 bool LookupOrInsert(Tagged<HeapObject> obj, int* index_out) {
153 auto find_result = map_.FindOrInsert(obj);
154 if (!find_result.already_exists) {
155 *find_result.entry = next_index_++;
156 }
157 *index_out = *find_result.entry;
158 return find_result.already_exists;
159 }
160 bool LookupOrInsert(Handle<HeapObject> obj, int* index_out) {
161 return LookupOrInsert(*obj, index_out);
162 }
163
164 bool Lookup(Tagged<HeapObject> obj, int* index_out) const {
165 int* index = map_.Find(obj);
166 if (index == nullptr) {
167 return false;
168 }
169 *index_out = *index;
170 return true;
171 }
172
173 Handle<FixedArray> Values(Isolate* isolate);
174
175 int size() const { return next_index_; }
176
177 private:
178 IdentityMap<int, base::DefaultAllocationPolicy> map_;
179 int next_index_;
180};

182class Serializer : public SerializerDeserializer {
183 public:
184 Serializer(Isolate* isolate, Snapshot::SerializerFlags flags);
185 ~Serializer() override { DCHECK_EQ(unresolved_forward_refs_, 0); }
186 Serializer(const Serializer&) = delete;
187 Serializer& operator=(const Serializer&) = delete;
188
189 const std::vector<uint8_t>* Payload() const { return sink_.data(); }
190
191 bool ReferenceMapContains(Handle<HeapObject> o) {
192 return reference_map()->LookupReference(o) != nullptr;
193 }
194
195 Isolate* isolate() const { return isolate_; }
196
197 // The pointer compression cage base value used for decompression of all
198 // tagged values except references to InstructionStream objects.
199 PtrComprCageBase cage_base() const {
200#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
201 return cage_base_;
202#else
203 return PtrComprCageBase{};
204#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
205 }
206
207 int TotalAllocationSize() const;
208
209 protected:
210 using PendingObjectReferences = std::vector<int>*;
211
212 class ObjectSerializer;
213 class V8_NODISCARD RecursionScope {
214 public:
215 explicit RecursionScope(Serializer* serializer) : serializer_(serializer) {
216 serializer_->recursion_depth_++;
217 }
218 ~RecursionScope() { serializer_->recursion_depth_--; }
219 bool ExceedsMaximum() const {
220 return serializer_->recursion_depth_ > kMaxRecursionDepth;
221 }
222 int ExceedsMaximumBy() const {
223 return serializer_->recursion_depth_ - kMaxRecursionDepth;
224 }
225
226 private:
227 static const int kMaxRecursionDepth = 32;
228 Serializer* serializer_;
229 };

296 void QueueDeferredObject(Tagged<HeapObject> obj) {
297 DCHECK_NULL(reference_map_.LookupReference(obj));
298 deferred_objects_.Push(obj);

302 // will be serialized later and any references to it should be pending forward
303 // references.

323 SnapshotByteSink sink_; // Used directly by subclasses.
324
325 bool allow_unknown_external_references_for_testing() const {
326 return (flags_ & Snapshot::kAllowUnknownExternalReferencesForTesting) != 0;
327 }

329 return (flags_ & Snapshot::kAllowActiveIsolateForTesting) != 0;
330 }

333 return (flags_ &
334 Snapshot::kReconstructReadOnlyAndSharedObjectCachesForTesting) != 0;
335 }
336
337 bool deferred_objects_empty() { return deferred_objects_.size() == 0; }
338
339 protected:
340 bool serializer_tracks_serialization_statistics() const {
341 return serializer_tracks_serialization_statistics_;
342 }
343 void set_serializer_tracks_serialization_statistics(bool v) {
344 serializer_tracks_serialization_statistics_ = v;
345 }
346
347 private:
348 // A circular queue of hot objects. This is added to in the same order as in
349 // Deserializer::HotObjectsList, but this stores the objects as an array of
350 // raw addresses that are considered strong roots. This allows objects to be
351 // added to the list without having to extend their handle's lifetime.
352 //
353 // We should never allow this class to return Handles to objects in the queue,
354 // as the object in the queue may change if kSize other objects are added to
355 // the queue during that Handle's lifetime.
356 class HotObjectsList {
357 public:
358 explicit HotObjectsList(Heap* heap);
359 ~HotObjectsList();
360 HotObjectsList(const HotObjectsList&) = delete;
361 HotObjectsList& operator=(const HotObjectsList&) = delete;
362
363 void Add(Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
364 circular_queue_[index_] = object.ptr();
365 index_ = (index_ + 1) & kSizeMask;
366 }
367
368 static const int kNotFound = -1;
369
370 int Find(Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
371 DCHECK(!AllowGarbageCollection::IsAllowed());
372 for (int i = 0; i < kSize; i++) {
373 if (circular_queue_[i] == object.ptr()) {
374 return i;
375 }
376 }
377 return kNotFound;
378 }
379
380 private:
381 static const int kSize = kHotObjectCount;
382 static const int kSizeMask = kSize - 1;
383 static_assert(base::bits::IsPowerOfTwo(kSize));
384 Heap* heap_;
385 StrongRootsEntry* strong_roots_entry_;
386 Address circular_queue_[kSize] = {kNullAddress};
387 int index_ = 0;
388 };
389
390 // Disallow GC during serialization.
391 // TODO(leszeks, v8:10815): Remove this constraint.
392 DISALLOW_GARBAGE_COLLECTION(no_gc_)
393
394 Isolate* isolate_;
395#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
396 const PtrComprCageBase cage_base_;
397#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
398 HotObjectsList hot_objects_;
399 SerializerReferenceMap reference_map_;
400 ExternalReferenceEncoder external_reference_encoder_;
401 RootIndexMap root_index_map_;
402 std::unique_ptr<CodeAddressMap> code_address_map_;
403 std::vector<uint8_t> code_buffer_;
404 GlobalHandleVector<HeapObject>
405 deferred_objects_; // To handle stack overflow.
406 int num_back_refs_ = 0;
407
408 // Objects which have started being serialized, but haven't yet been allocated
409 // with the allocator, are considered "pending". References to them don't have
410 // an allocation to backref to, so instead they are registered as pending
411 // forward references, which are resolved once the object is allocated.
412 //
413 // Forward references are registered in a deterministic order, and can
414 // therefore be identified by an incrementing integer index, which is
415 // effectively an index into a vector of the currently registered forward
416 // refs. The references in this vector might not be resolved in order, so we
417 // can only clear it (and reset the indices) when there are no unresolved
418 // forward refs remaining.
419 int next_forward_ref_id_ = 0;
420 int unresolved_forward_refs_ = 0;
421 IdentityMap<PendingObjectReferences, base::DefaultAllocationPolicy>
422 forward_refs_per_pending_object_;
423
424 // Used to keep track of the off-heap backing stores used by TypedArrays/
425 // ArrayBuffers. Note that the index begins at 1 and not 0, because when a
426 // TypedArray has an on-heap backing store, the backing_store pointer in the
427 // corresponding ArrayBuffer will be null, which makes it indistinguishable
428 // from index 0.
429 uint32_t seen_backing_stores_index_ = 1;
430
431 int recursion_depth_ = 0;
432 const Snapshot::SerializerFlags flags_;
433
434 bool serializer_tracks_serialization_statistics_ = true;
435 size_t allocation_size_[kNumberOfSnapshotSpaces] = {0};
436#ifdef OBJECT_PRINT
437// Verbose serialization_statistics output is only enabled conditionally.
438#define VERBOSE_SERIALIZATION_STATISTICS
439#endif
440#ifdef VERBOSE_SERIALIZATION_STATISTICS
441 static constexpr int kInstanceTypes = LAST_TYPE + 1;
442 std::unique_ptr<int[]> instance_type_count_[kNumberOfSnapshotSpaces];
443 std::unique_ptr<size_t[]> instance_type_size_[kNumberOfSnapshotSpaces];
444#endif // VERBOSE_SERIALIZATION_STATISTICS
445
446#ifdef DEBUG
447 GlobalHandleVector<HeapObject> back_refs_;
448 GlobalHandleVector<HeapObject> stack_;
449#endif // DEBUG
450};

452class Serializer::ObjectSerializer : public ObjectVisitor {
453 public:
454 ObjectSerializer(Serializer* serializer, Handle<HeapObject> obj,
455 SnapshotByteSink* sink)
456 : isolate_(serializer->isolate()),
457 serializer_(serializer),
458 object_(obj),
459 sink_(sink),
460 bytes_processed_so_far_(0) {
461#ifdef DEBUG
462 serializer_->PushStack(obj);
463#endif // DEBUG
464 }
465 ~ObjectSerializer() override {
466#ifdef DEBUG
467 serializer_->PopStack();
468#endif // DEBUG
469 }
470 void Serialize(SlotType slot_type);
471 void SerializeObject();
472 void SerializeDeferred();
473 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, ObjectSlot start,
474 ObjectSlot end) override;
475 void VisitPointers(Tagged<HeapObject> host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
476 MaybeObjectSlot end) override;
477 void VisitInstructionStreamPointer(Tagged<Code> host,
478 InstructionStreamSlot slot) override;
479 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
480 RelocInfo* target) override;
481 void VisitExternalReference(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
482 RelocInfo* rinfo) override;
483 void VisitInternalReference(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
484 RelocInfo* rinfo) override;
485 void VisitCodeTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
486 RelocInfo* target) override;
487 void VisitOffHeapTarget(Tagged<InstructionStream> host,
488 RelocInfo* target) override;
489
490 void VisitExternalPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
491 ExternalPointerSlot slot) override;
492 void VisitIndirectPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host, IndirectPointerSlot slot,
493 IndirectPointerMode mode) override;
494 void VisitTrustedPointerTableEntry(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
495 IndirectPointerSlot slot) override;
496 void VisitProtectedPointer(Tagged<TrustedObject> host,
497 ProtectedPointerSlot slot) override;
498 void VisitCppHeapPointer(Tagged<HeapObject> host,
499 CppHeapPointerSlot slot) override;
500
501 Isolate* isolate() { return isolate_; }
502
503 private:
504 void SerializePrologue(SnapshotSpace space, int size, Tagged<Map> map);
505
506 // This function outputs or skips the raw data between the last pointer and
507 // up to the current position.
508 void SerializeContent(Tagged<Map> map, int size);
509 void OutputExternalReference(Address target, int target_size, bool sandboxify,
510 ExternalPointerTag tag);
511 void OutputRawData(Address up_to);
512 uint32_t SerializeBackingStore(void* backing_store, uint32_t byte_length,
513 Maybe<uint32_t> max_byte_length);
514 void SerializeJSTypedArray();
515 void SerializeJSArrayBuffer();
516 void SerializeExternalString();
517 void SerializeExternalStringAsSequentialString();
518
519 Isolate* isolate_;
520 Serializer* serializer_;
521 Handle<HeapObject> object_;
522 SnapshotByteSink* sink_;
523 int bytes_processed_so_far_;
524};
